text: sixty-four people are now known to have
died in a massive fire at a shopping
center in the Siberian city of Kemerovo
many of the victims are children nearly
300 firefighters battled to contain the
blaze as Andrew Plante reports the fire
broke out in the winter cherry Mawr
while it was packed with Sunday shoppers
a fire on the fourth floor this shopping
center surrounded by firefighters
searching for survivors trying to reach
upper floor windows fighting the smoke
billowing outside the fire started here
on Sunday dozens were evacuated but it
was clear dozens more were missing many
of them children paralysis Tower
deadbolt out the area of the fire is
about 1500 square meters at this moment
288 emergency officers are working
on-site as well as sixty two units of
equipment and an airborne grouping are
taking part in the search and rescue
operation we are taking all necessary
measures to extinguish the fire the
shopping center has a very complex
construction there is a lot of
combustible materials people gathered to
stand and stare as the fire unfolded
witnesses said it trapped people on the
upper floors and said some had jumped
from windows to try to escape from the
flames an industrial city of more than
half a million it is one of Russia's
biggest coal producing regions more than
2,000 kilometers east of Moscow already
there are reports the fire began near a
cinema and children's entertainment
center President Putin has already sent
his condolences to friends and family of
the victims authorities say a criminal
investigation will now begin to try to
find out what caused the fire Andrew
plant BBC news let's go over to Paul
Adams in Moscow and Paul terrible events
the number of dead dramatically rising
over the course of the last few hours
yeah it has particularly just the few
hours of this morning from only about 30
overnight to now in excess of 60 we
believe the number of missing which was
also very high at one point seems to
have come down quite a bit so it may be
that we
are reaching a final conclusion on the
number of dead one of the problems is
that part of the roof of the complex
collapsed which has made it very
difficult for firefighters to access the
upper floors of the mall so I think it
may be some time before we get a
complete picture of how many people died
in the meantime of course an
investigation is getting underway and
there have already been some detentions
people have been questioned people who
are connected with the ownership of the
complex and those also who renter's of
shops within the complex in fact in the
last hour or so on the TAS News Agency
we heard that one of those detained was
indeed a renter of an area close to what
is believed to be the point where the
fire began trouble is people don't quite
know exactly where it began yet one
theory is that it may have been in or
near one of the cinemas another theory
that it could have been in a children's
play area also reports that the children
were unattended there's been some awful
graphic footage from inside the mall
showing in one case desperate people
trying to batter down a fire door which
appears to be locked so an awful lot for
investigations investigators to try and
get their heads around and Paul you
mentioned children there are so many
child casualties among the dead yeah
this was the start of the holiday the
school holiday is also the middle of
some day an area that a complex that has
cinemas a bowling alley a children's
play area even we're told a petting zoo
and so tragically I think it was the the
whole complex was absolutely crammed
yesterday and an awful lot of those
people will have been children
Paul presumably a lot of questions now
being asked about the construction of
this building and why something like
this was allowed to take hold and how it
took hold so very quickly yeah as you
heard in that report a lot of
combustible materials inside the smoke
that came pouring out of the windows was
thick and black so clearly that the the
fire inside must have been very intense
we've heard of people
receiving carbon monoxide poisoning the
investigators are understood to be
wanting to speak to the owner of the
complex now he is a billionaire who
lives in Australia we believe so it's
not clear whether they're going to be
able to get to him to speak to him it's
thought that the ownership of the
complex is is somewhat complex affair
and the questions already being raised
about exactly what you ask the fire
standards the the escapes and so forth I
think it's fair to say that particularly
in that part of Russia in Siberia the
record in recent years has shown that
these things are not always properly
regulated and that fires do sometimes
have far more tragic consequences than
they ought well thank you very much Paul
Adams there in Moscow reporting on
events in Kemerovo in Siberia
